üõ†Ô∏è ActionStack Tools: Your App‚Äôs Rad Crew ‚Äã

ActionStack packs a punch with its built-in tools‚ÄîLogger, Performance Monitor, and State Freezer. They‚Äôre like your app‚Äôs personal hype squad: one‚Äôs sniffing out bugs, another‚Äôs keeping things speedy, and the last one‚Äôs guarding your state like it‚Äôs the VIP lounge.

üß© Middleware: The ActionStack Checkpoint ‚Äã

These tools roll as middleware, acting like bouncers at the club:

action ‚Üí starter ‚Üí middleware chain ‚Üí store.dispatch ‚Üí new state

Every action gets a quick vibe check before it can slide into the dispatch and update your app‚Äôs state.

Why Middleware? ‚Äã

Middleware hooks into your dispatch to keep things tight. Set it up like this:

ts
import { createStore, applyMiddleware } from '@epikodelabs/actionstack';
import { logger, perfmon, storeFreeze } from '@epikodelabs/actionstack/tools';

export const store = createStore(applyMiddleware(logger, perfmon, storeFreeze));
1
2
3
4

When an action hits:

  1. Logger scribbles what‚Äôs up in the console.
  2. Performance Monitor clocks the speed.
  3. State Freezer locks down any shady state changes.
  4. Then, the action cruises to the dispatch method.

Middleware can pass, tweak, or (rarely) block actions, but these tools mostly just watch and keep things smooth.

‚ö° The Lineup ‚Äã

1. Logger ‚Äã

Your debugging wingman, catching every move.

  • Logs action details (name, type, payload) and state changes.
  • Spots bugs or weird side effects.
  • Offers log levels‚Äîchill info or loud error.

2. Performance Monitor ‚Äã

The speed junkie making sure your app doesn‚Äôt lag.

  • Times actions and state updates.
  • Flags anything slowing down the party.
  • Drops metrics to boost performance.

3. State Freezer ‚Äã

The state‚Äôs bodyguard, keeping it untouchable.

  • Blocks sneaky state edits.
  • Throws errors if someone tries to mess with it.
  • Ensures your app stays predictable.

‚öôÔ∏è Getting Started ‚Äã

Snag ActionStack:

bash
npm install @epikodelabs/actionstack
1

Then, plug in the tools:

ts
import { createStore, applyMiddleware } from '@epikodelabs/actionstack';
import { logger, storeFreeze } from '@epikodelabs/actionstack/tools';

export const store = createStore(applyMiddleware(logger, storeFreeze));
1
2
3
4

üé¨ Wrap-Up ‚Äã

Logger, Performance Monitor, and State Freezer are your app‚Äôs all-star crew, posted up between actions and store.dispatch. They track, time, and protect, so your app stays slick and stress-free.

‚ÄúYou won‚Äôt lose your mind if you use the right tools in the right place. Because, seriously, who needs the chaos of a buggy app when you‚Äôve got this squad?‚Äù üåüüöÄ
